description:
'''Tropical Depression''' is a [[Filipino people|Filipino]] [[reggae]] band formed in 1987 by vocalist and guitarist Dominic "Papadom" Gamboa (1965-2013) and guitarist Lawrence "Bonglennon" Eudela. The band went into the mainstream in 1990. Aside from Gamboa and Eudela, the band's notable line-up was composed of guitarist Lito Crisostomo, bassist Pex Holigores, keyboardists TJ Espinola and Mike Llacar, back-up vocalists Arlene Empalmado and Lala Lejeune, and drummer Brutus Lacano.

The band was one of the several bands who spearheaded the 1990s [[Music of the Philippines|Pinoy rock]] explosion and popularized the songs "Kapayapaan", "Bilog Na Naman ang Buwan" and "Alaala".
